answers.answer: They say that only 1/3 of the women who fail have gestational diabetes, go in for my test tomaro :S
Why did they make you have a second test if you passed the first one?
I failed my one hour but passed my 4 hour.

I hope im the 1/3 that doesn't have it. Girl idk, they did one when I was like 4 months and now again at 8 months? I guess because things can change within that time, I have no clue why I had to do it twice. Both were just 1 hours now its the 3 hours im over here dreading it.

Never heard of a 4 hr. And I've never heard of taking it twice if you pass the first one. Btw I've been working in a success office since im 16 and have been to medical school. Im 25 btw do been awhile lol

My sons 4 so back 5 years ago Idr if I took it twice or not so I thought it was normal doing it twice. =/ so now im doing it 3 times. I guess ill have to ask my dr, im just freaked out about possibly have diabetes. ..

My daughter is almost 3 I know with her I took it once.maybe it has changed? I have a sheet with all the major tests at my ob office and when they do them and it only has it losted once. I know I take mine between 25-28 weeks it could very well be like u said because they tested so early. Good luck with it hope everything goes well:)
Thanks ma (; hope your pregnancy goes good as well

question: Im 33 weeks, I passed my first one, & last week failed my 2nd one by one point. =/ I have to re-do it for the 3 hour one. Have any of yall failed & ended up not having diabetes???
title: glucose test,
